title: Aluminum Rises to 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,747.05 per tonne on October 15, 2025, marking a 0.03% increase from the previous day and reaching the highest level in over three years. The price has increased 1.20% over the past month and 6.15% year-over-year, driven by tight supply and bullish demand expectations, with Chinese authorities lowering their base metals output growth targets.

title: LME WEEK: US aluminum price rise spurs deliveries from Canada
summary: US aluminum prices around $2,750 per ton have encouraged increased deliveries from Canada, although not yet at full pace. The Midwest premium reached a record $0.77 per lb on October 6, reflecting a 250% rise since January, largely due to a 50% import tariff. Canadian exports to the US have fallen year-on-year, while deliveries to Europe have surged, influencing premiums in both markets.

title: US aluminum prices soar after Novelis's Oswego supply disruption
summary: A supply disruption at Novelis's Oswego plant, combined with existing 50% import tariffs, caused the US Midwest aluminum premium to soar to a record $0.77 per lb as of October 6, significantly impacting prices and market dynamics.

title: Price of Aluminum: Mill Fire Adds Fuel to in U.S. Prices
summary: European aluminum plate and sheet prices increased significantly in early October, with the 5083 aluminum plate rising 3.79% and the 1050 aluminum sheet up 3.74%. LME primary three-month aluminum prices also rose by 2.61%, while some Korean aluminum prices declined, reflecting mixed regional market trends influenced by supply disruptions such as mill fires.

title: Aluminium price hits 16-month high amid supply tightness
summary: Aluminum prices settled at a 16-month high of 262.95, driven by strength in LME prices amid declining inventories and tight supply conditions.

title: CPI Rebound Coupled with Inventory Drawdown, Aluminum Prices Hold Up Well in the Short Term
summary: Technical analysis of SHFE aluminum contracts shows limited price fluctuations with short-term pressure but a medium to long-term bullish trend supported by inventory drawdowns and CPI rebound. Market participation remains low with a wait-and-see sentiment prevailing.

title: SMM Flash News: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Drops by 1,600 mt to 54,800 mt on Oct 16
summary: China's domestic secondary aluminum ingot inventory decreased by 1,600 metric tons to 54,800 metric tons as of October 16, 2025, according to SMM data. This reflects ongoing adjustments in secondary aluminum supply within the Chinese market.

title: Gov't invites feedback on $2B plan to support green aluminium manufacturing
summary: The Australian Government has launched a public consultation for its $2 billion Green Aluminium Production Credit to boost domestic aluminium manufacturing and support the transition to renewable energy. The initiative aims to help aluminium smelters shift to renewable electricity, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and strengthen Australia's position in sustainable aluminium production.

title: Dutch Nouryon completes metal alkyls capacity expansion in China
summary: Nouryon has doubled its production capacity of triethyl aluminum (TEAL), a metal alkyl used in plastics manufacturing, at its Jiaxing facility in China. The company also plans to start producing modified methylaluminoxane (MMAO) in China by 2027, a catalyst used in solar panel materials, reflecting Nouryon's commitment to innovation in polymer specialties.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: This article explores the sustainability benefits of circular aluminium, highlighting its infinite recyclability and low energy requirements for remanufacturing compared to virgin aluminium. It discusses aluminium's potential to reduce reliance on plastics and support a circular economy, emphasizing the need for increased recycling infrastructure and stakeholder engagement to drive adoption.

title: Recycled aluminium for sustainable shipbuilding
summary: Speira’s VIA Maris recycled aluminium alloys offer improved mechanical properties and a lower CO2 footprint, making them ideal for maritime and offshore applications. London-based yacht builder Arksen is using these marine-grade recycled aluminium alloys for its new hybrid propulsion yachts, advancing sustainability in shipbuilding.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News
summary: Chinese buyers are seeking alternative sources, leading to increased price premiums for non-BHP cargoes. There is growing volatility in spot market prices and inventory movements as traders reposition their stocks. Chinese steel producers face the urgent task of securing alternative supply sources, potentially benefiting other major iron ore producers like Vale and Rio Tinto.

title: Kallanish Global Flat Steel 2025 Conference
summary: The Kallanish Global Flat Steel 2025 conference will discuss current issues affecting the global flat steel market. The event addresses concerns over US tariffs and their impact on global trade, as well as rising Chinese exports and potential trade cases. The EU is reviewing its safeguard measures and adjusting the CBAM ahead of its full launch in 2026.

title: Baosteel Maintains Steel Prices for October
summary: Baosteel, a subsidiary of China Baowu Steel Group, has announced that it will maintain its domestic steel prices for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coils in October. This decision reflects the current market conditions and pricing strategies of major steel producers.

title: Hadeed Cuts Long Steel Prices for October
summary: The Saudi Iron and Steel Company (Hadeed) has reduced long steel prices by SAR 75 (USD 20) per ton for October production. This move could influence regional steel market dynamics and pricing trends.

title: Global Steel Demand Projected to Remain Flat in 2025, Rebound in 2026
summary: The World Steel Association projects global steel demand to remain flat in 2025 at about 1,750 million tonnes, with a modest rebound of 1.3% expected in 2026. This growth is driven by trends in regions like India, Vietnam, Egypt, and Saudi Arabia. The U.S. is expected to see a rebound in steel demand due to infrastructure spending and easing financing conditions.

title: U.S. Trade Representative Highlights Efforts to Address Global Steel Excess Capacity
summary: The U.S. Trade Representative emphasized the need for collective action to address global steel excess capacity, which distorts markets and harms U.S. producers. The Specialty Steel Industry of North America supports these efforts to develop a new framework to resolve this issue. The Trump Administration has taken steps to counter excess capacity in the U.S. market.

title: U.S. Raw Steel Production Increases by 8.4% Year-on-Year
summary: Domestic raw steel production in the U.S. increased by 8.4% compared to the same period last year, reaching 1,722,000 net tons. The capability utilization rate was 76.0%. This reflects a slight decrease from the previous week but an overall increase year-on-year.

title: 3rd Saudi International Iron & Steel Conference Highlights Green Steel Innovations
summary: The conference focuses on the future of green steel production, discussing innovations such as Electric Arc Furnaces, Direct Reduced Iron, and hydrogen-based steelmaking. Industry leaders explore AI-driven automation, smart manufacturing, and sustainability practices including ESG, circular economy, and energy efficiency in steel production.

title: InfraBuild wins Innovation of the Year at World Steel Association awards
summary: InfraBuild was recognized for its innovative contributions to steel technology at the World Steel Association awards, highlighting advancements that support sustainable steel production and industry transformation.

title: Accelerating innovation through collaboration: a sustainable future for mineral resources and green steel
summary: CSIRO researchers emphasize cross-disciplinary collaboration to advance decarbonization in mineral processing and green steel production. Efforts include applying carbon capture technologies, hydrogen plasma smelting, and integrating AI, machine learning, and robotics to improve efficiency and sustainability in mining and steelmaking.

title: European Green Steel Summit 2025: shaping the future of the steel industry
summary: The summit addresses carbon emission reduction, green steel production, and innovative technologies aimed at transforming the steel industry towards sustainability and lower environmental impact.

title: Chinese Copper Smelters Plan Exports After Surge in LME Prices
summary: Chinese copper smelters are increasing exports due to near-record London Metal Exchange (LME) prices, arranging up to 25,000 tons of spot shipments to bonded warehouses and Asian depots. This surge follows global mine disruptions and US monetary easing, which have boosted copper prices, while domestic Chinese demand slows amid higher costs and weaker margins.

title: Copper Price Surge Approaches Record Highs in 2025
summary: Copper prices have surged toward record highs, reaching $10,866.25 per tonne and approaching the previous peak of $11,400 per tonne from May 2024. The market shows strong institutional interest and technical momentum, driven by structural supply deficits, declining ore grades, and growing demand linked to the global energy transition and electric vehicle adoption.

title: Chinese Copper Export Avalanche Reshapes Global Markets Amidst Arbitrage Frenzy
summary: Chinese copper smelters are exporting unprecedented volumes due to arbitrage opportunities between international and domestic prices, reshaping global supply chains. This export surge comes amid persistent global supply deficits and strong demand from the energy transition, temporarily easing LME inventory shortages but not resolving underlying structural tightness.

title: Commodity Radar: Copper prices cool off after Monday's sharp rally
summary: Copper prices fell sharply on Tuesday after a strong rally on Monday, with MCX October futures dropping 2.4% amid profit taking and international price declines. Supply disruptions in major mines and expectations of US interest rate cuts had previously pushed prices to a 16-month high near $11,000 per ton, supported by robust demand from green energy and electric vehicles.

title: Copper Prices Drift Upward Despite Stock Surplus
summary: Copper prices have risen 3.7% from September to October, with Comex prices surpassing $11,000 per metric ton. Despite a surplus in stocks and global economic headwinds, bullish fundamentals such as data center demand and raw material constraints support the upward trend, although some softness in renewables forecasts tempers the outlook.

title: Weaker dollar, Fed cut bets drive copper up
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.9% to $10,675 per metric ton, supported by a weaker US dollar and expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. These macroeconomic factors are contributing to upward pressure on copper prices amid ongoing supply concerns.

title: Saudi Aramco Expands into Metal Trading, LME Copper Edged Down Slightly Overnight
summary: Saudi Aramco is entering the metal trading market by hiring copper traders, signaling a strategic diversification amid the energy transition. Meanwhile, LME copper prices showed volatility, opening at $10,681/mt and closing slightly down at $10,576/mt, reflecting mixed market sentiment.

title: Chinese Copper Smelters Plan Exports After Surge in LME Prices
summary: Chinese copper smelters are increasing exports due to near-record London Metal Exchange (LME) prices, arranging up to 25,000 tons of spot shipments to bonded warehouses and Asian depots. This surge is driven by a rally in copper prices following global mine disruptions and US monetary easing, despite weakening domestic demand in China.

title: Chinese Copper Smelters Export Surge: Global Impact
summary: Chinese copper smelters are exporting over 25,000 tons of copper in spot shipments, with monthly volumes potentially reaching 50,000 tons. The surge is due to softening domestic demand amid rising production costs and a significant decline in the Yangshan copper premium, making foreign sales more attractive.

title: Chinese Copper Export Avalanche Reshapes Global Markets Amidst Arbitrage Frenzy
summary: Chinese copper smelters are capitalizing on near-record LME prices and a premium for immediate delivery outside China, causing an unprecedented surge in exports. This export wave temporarily replenishes LME inventories but does not resolve underlying supply deficits caused by mine disruptions and strong long-term demand.

title: Copper demand to rise 24% by 2035, says Wood Mackenzie
summary: Wood Mackenzie forecasts a 24% increase in global copper demand by 2035, driven by economic development and structural demand from electrification and digitalization. The energy transition is a key factor, with electric vehicle-related copper demand expected to double by 2035, highlighting copper's critical role in the global energy shift.

title: Japan, Spain and South Korea warn over unsustainable copper processing fees
summary: Japan, Spain, and South Korea issued a joint statement expressing concern over falling copper treatment and refining charges (TC/RCs), which threaten the sustainability of copper smelting operations. The decline in fees, partly due to expanding Chinese smelting capacity and tight concentrate supply, is causing some smelters to consider scaling back or exiting the market.

title: BHP Resolution Copper Mine: 7 Innovations For 2025
summary: The BHP Resolution Copper Mine is implementing seven key innovations by 2025 to enhance sustainability and efficiency. These include automated drilling and haulage, advanced ore processing, intelligent mine management, water recycling, sustainable land reclamation, renewable energy integration, and community engagement, collectively reducing CO2 emissions and increasing copper output significantly.

title: Copper's Golden Decade: Global Market Set to Soar Beyond $450 Billion by 2034, Fueling Green Transition and Industrial Evolution
summary: Copper demand is projected to rise sharply due to its critical role in green energy transition, electrification, and electric vehicles, which require significantly more copper than traditional technologies. This growth is supported by infrastructure development and technological advancements, although supply challenges like declining ore grades and slow mine development persist.

title: Smart Mining: Innovation at the Core of the Resource Revolution
summary: A panel discussion highlights how innovation, sustainability, and digitalization are transforming copper mining. Topics include AI-driven exploration, automation, decarbonization, and sustainable mineral extraction, emphasizing the integration of advanced technologies to improve efficiency and environmental performance in mining.

title: Anaconda Copper Mine 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: The Anaconda Copper Mine exemplifies sustainable mining through AI, digital monitoring, eco-rehabilitation, and automation. It serves as a model for balancing resource extraction with environmental stewardship and community resilience, leveraging blockchain and carbon monitoring for transparency and sustainability.

title: Copper Rally Soars on China's 2025 Demand Amidst Escalating Trade Tensions
summary: Copper prices have surged due to strong demand from China driven by electric vehicles, renewable energy, and data centers. Supply constraints and geopolitical tensions are intensifying market tightness, with forecasts indicating potential supply deficits and increased activity in mining and supply chain sectors.

title: Mining innovation takes centre stage during Sudbury Mining Week
summary: Sudbury Mining Week 2025 focuses on innovation and sustainability in mining, featuring industry leaders and educational events. The event promotes mining's role in modern society and sustainable development, with interactive exhibits and workshops aimed at inspiring youth and strengthening industry-community partnerships.

title: Nickel prices continued to fluctuate on October 16
summary: Nickel prices continued to fluctuate due to broad money supply increases and ongoing market uncertainties. The SMM #1 refined nickel price was between 120,700-123,600 yuan/mt. The most-traded SHFE nickel contract edged higher during the session.

title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
summary: Nickel decreased to 15,151.00 USD/T, marking a four-week low. Over the past month, nickel's price has fallen 1.68%, and it is down 10.86% compared to the same time last year. Nickel futures previously rose to an eleven-week high due to supply concerns.

title: Nickel Market Trends
summary: The global nickel market is expected to face oversupply in Q4 due to shifting trade policies and increased inventory levels. Despite this, African mining projects continue to advance. Nickel prices have fallen significantly since 2022 due to supply outpacing demand.

title: Nickel mine using smelting and leaching processes to extract nickel
summary: A nickel mine is utilizing both smelting and leaching processes to extract nickel, highlighting innovation in mining techniques. The article does not provide specific details about new production capacities but emphasizes the use of advanced extraction methods. This approach can improve efficiency and reduce environmental impact.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review
summary: Nickel prices continued to fluctuate, with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 122,150 yuan/mt. The market is influenced by broader economic factors, including changes in social financing and money supply. However, there is no specific mention of new production capacities in this report.

title: Canada Nickel Releases Positive Results from Crawford Nickel Project Economic Impact Study
summary: Canada Nickel Company announced positive results from an economic impact study for its Crawford Nickel Project. The project is expected to contribute significantly to Canada's GDP and generate substantial tax revenues and employment opportunities. While not directly addressing current production capacity, it highlights future potential.

title: Dongjiang Environment granted U.S. patent for electroless nickel plating waste recycling technology
summary: Dongjiang Environment has been granted a U.S. patent for its innovative method of recycling electroless nickel plating waste, marking a significant breakthrough in industrial waste resource recovery. This technology is recognized internationally for its contribution to sustainable practices. The patent signifies a step forward in managing nickel-containing waste streams.

title: Queensland university $2.2 million grant win promises boost to battery supply chain
summary: Researchers at the Queensland University of Technology have secured a $2.2 million grant to develop a more efficient process for manufacturing battery cathode materials using Australian critical minerals like nickel. The project aims to reduce costs and emissions in cathode production. This innovation could enhance energy security in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a significant step in replacing fossil natural gas with green hydrogen in its industrial heat treatment process. This initiative aims to reduce CO₂ emissions substantially and supports the company's commitment to climate-neutral industrial processes.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter, expanding its presence in the seamless tubes and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes market. The acquisition aligns with Cogne's strategy to enhance competitiveness through upstream integration and broadens its product offerings for industries like aerospace, automotive, and energy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne, located in Aosta, has entered a new period in steel production with a green hydrogen facility
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is pioneering the use of green hydrogen in steel production by replacing fossil natural gas in its heat treatment process. The company also develops specialized stainless steels designed for hydrogen transport infrastructure, contributing to the energy transition and climate neutrality goals.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali published its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The report emphasizes the company's commitment to sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded a contract by Terna S.p.A. and STEG to construct a submarine power cable between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The cable will link Sicily and Tunisia's Cap Bon peninsula, with a potential contract value of around €460 million, pending certain conditions.

title: First Africa-Europe Power Bridge Moves Ahead As Contract Awarded for Submarine Cable
date: Not specified (article published after contract announcement)
summary: Prysmian has won the contract to build a high-voltage submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia, marking the first interconnector between Europe and North Africa. The 220 km cable will have a capacity of 600 MW and is a key component of the ELMED project.

title: Prysmian wins 460 mln euros power cable deal connecting Italy to Tunisia
date: Not specified (article published after contract announcement)
summary: Prysmian has secured a €460 million contract to build a submarine power cable linking Italy and Tunisia, advancing energy interconnection between the two countries.
